content:
Yes, Tel Aviv is a great city to explore on foot, but there are also other transportation options available. Here are some tips for getting around Tel Aviv:

1. Walking - Many of the main tourist attractions in Tel Aviv are in close proximity to each other, so walking is a great way to explore the city at a leisurely pace.

2. Public transportation - Tel Aviv has an extensive public transportation system, including a bus network and a light rail system, which is a fast and convenient way to travel around the city. 

3. Shared bicycles - Tel Aviv has a popular bike-share program called Tel-O-Fun, which allows users to rent bicycles from stations throughout the city.

4. Taxis - Taxis are widely available in Tel Aviv, and you can catch them on the street or call for one using a taxi-hailing app like Gett.

5. Car rentals - If you plan on traveling outside of Tel Aviv, or you prefer the convenience of having your own vehicle, car rentals are available at the airport and throughout the city.

Make sure to familiarize yourself with the different transportation options available, and plan your route ahead of time to avoid getting lost.
